page.title: 20THE RIVERS
page.content: THERE ARE TWO RIVERS IS OUR AREA, THE RIVER RODEN AND THE RIVER TERN. THE BRIDGE THAT CROSSES THE RIVER RODEN IN RODINGTON IS EXACTLY 100 YEARS OLD THIS YEAR. IT REPLACED A HORSE BRIDGE AND FORD. THE RIVER RODEN FLOWS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH OF OUR AREA. IT IS A SMALL RIVER, NOWHERE WIDER THAN 8 METRES. IT FLOWS INTO THE RIVER TERN AT WALCOT MILL. THERE IS NO LONGER A WORKING MILL AT WALCOT, BUT THE FIVE STOREY BUILDING STILL STANDS. THERE IS A WEIR WITH MACHINERY ON IT TO CONTROL THE FLOW OF WATER. THERE ARE 6 GATES ALTOGETHER BUT ONLY 4 ARE IN USE EXCEPT IN TIME OF FLOOD. ANY FLOOD WATER FLOWS INTO THE MILL POND. THERE IS TROUT AND COURSE FISHING ON THE RIVER TERN. THE FISHING RIGHTS AT WALCOT BELONG TO THE BRITISH SUGAR CORPORATION.
